Text:
Bhavini Patel is ending her campaign to be elected the next member of Congress, District 12.

Full statement below. https://t.co/TApTu0zrBs
RT @JustinAglio: RT: Iâ€™m so pumped to moderate/host this amazing Panel Conversation on #FutureReady #Education Policy Implications!!! TY, @â€¦
Tune in tonight!! https://t.co/u1Ft8KYD8n

This pick is important because it's long overdue, adds a necessary perspective, and sends a strong message of inspiration to young women of color that their perspectives matter and they can serve in the highest leadership roles.

SCOTUS has existed for 232 yrs and only 5 women have ever been nominated.
Picking Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to be a SCOTUS nominee makes 6 women and 1 Black woman.
Her addition to the court is important. I'm hopeful for a swift confirmation process. https://t.co/25BOXSmsdQ

My heart is with the people of Ukraine this morning.

It's times like these that we need steady and focused leadership. I trust all those focusing on the crisis in Ukraine to use the intelligence we gather to make the right decisions as this tragic crisis develops.

RT @905wesa: Bhavini Patel is ramping up her Congressional bid to replace Mike Doyle, @CPotterPgh reports. 

â€œIt's one thing to know Pittsbâ€¦

This campaign is going to every part of #PA18 to talk about kitchen table issues that matter to everyday Pennsylvanians.

Thank you to Baldwin Borough Democratic Committee for welcoming us to your meeting last night! https://t.co/FsNui71QrR

When unions win, everyone wins.

#UnionStrong https://t.co/bR2CILiT5j

This campaign is working every day to connect with voters across the region. This week, we were in Plum with the Plum Borough Democratic Committee who are looking for representation in Congress they can trust and will prioritize the issues that matter to their community. https://t.co/pf6H4Tkzls

More than 60 people joined the Zoom conversation in the 14th Ward Pgh Democratic Committee this week. It's humbling to see when so many people engage in the political process and eager to learn about and share the issues that matter to those who live and work in our region. https://t.co/I0VIGUNrDU

My family has a food truck that operates in Oakland - which is part of PGH's 4th Ward. Elected officials look to Oakland for Pitt students. I also know that there are families and full time residents who call that part of Pittsburgh home. I'm going to fight for them. https://t.co/5Cl7Hdv7q5

Busy week visiting with Democrats across the region! Our tent is big and diverse and one thing I know is every municipality here cares about kitchen table issues Iâ€™m fighting for.
#Dems @AlleghenyDems

Thank you to @NickforPA for welcoming me to his re-election kickoff event at @iwlocal3 in Pittsburgh. Rep. Pisciottano is a strong advocate for labor and working families. He's making a difference. It was great to see him along with old friends and new ones. https://t.co/ZLUygfcTWh
Excited to speak with WGFDisruptors tonight at 6pm on Instagram! Be sure to tune in!! https://t.co/MmvgH12cNU

Thank you Swissvale Dem Committee for having me last night and sharing what you believe are the issues that matter the most to the people of Swissvale.

This campaign is about reaching out to every part of the 18th Congressional District to talk about kitchen table issues. https://t.co/vLLJHa5SzS
My Story is Pittsburgh's Story https://t.co/4NkAMR0jNt

Our region has so much to offer. And our next representative should be someone who has participated in the innovation economy, understands it, and can make sure that everybody has access to it. Thatâ€™s something I am truly excited about.

Sat down with @JonDelano at @KDKA to discuss the opportunity in our region, Congress, and my campaign to be elected.

Hereâ€™s a little bit of my conversation where we talk about that. ðŸ‘‡ https://t.co/FrSYjiVHo5
@JonDelano @USRepMikeDoyle @JerrySDickinson @SteveIrwinPA @SummerForPA @KDKA Thank you for taking time to talk with me about this campaign and our region!

Thank you to the @southpark_dems Committee for having me at your meeting on Wednesday.
Democrats in South Park and the region are strong and I was happy to have the opportunity to speak with you all this week. https://t.co/mi9p8NBlbm

RT @PatelForPA: The role of someone serving in US Congress is to pick up the phone when people of the district reach out. I connectedÂ withâ€¦

"I want someone in Congress who can get the work done and listen to the people of North Braddock. We're a small community so it's easy to forget us. We need someone like Bhavini because she takes the time to get to know us, our issues, and what we need from D.C." -Theresa Parker

The role of someone serving in US Congress is to pick up the phone when people of the district reach out. I connectedÂ with Theresa Parker, council member for North Braddock Borough, and I look forward to working with her in the future. Thrilled to have her support. https://t.co/WT2np7JlPY

Recognized for my work as the founder of a civic tech company, I'm excited about the potential of our innovation economy and investment in workforce development. We must work hard to ensure that everyone has access to the jobs and opportunities created by this new economy. #TBT
Throwback Thursday to being recognized as 40 Under 40 alongside a cohort of innovators and thought leaders striving to build our region forward! #TBT #ThrowbackThursday https://t.co/JPynhT0na6

The apprentices who train at the facility here in our region work on job sites throughout PA. There are 192 apprentices right now and when they graduate, they will have zero student loan debt and have a job that pays a fair wage. #Labor and our #unions in #SWPA are strong.
Thank you to the leaders at @SMLocal12 who took me on a tour today of their training facility in Harmar! @SMLocal12TC https://t.co/L7IfyhXhgR

The municipalities in our region depend on a diverse economy and I'm committed to making our government work for each one of them. This campaign is about the issues that impact all our various municipalities.
Thank you John Vahosky, member of North Braddock Borough Council. https://t.co/HAxZJ161Yj
Thank you!! Got mine in the mail yesterday. ðŸ˜Ž https://t.co/7udTB57WuL https://t.co/iSIzKa65ZR

"The Indian American co-founded a civic tech company that has created an app to keep citizens connected to state legislators to address social justice and inequality." @AmericanKahani

Now, I'm running for Congress. Let's get to work. #PA18 https://t.co/geU1XB5hlg

Mayor Adam Forgie is someone who knows what Turtle Creek and this region needs. He's known and trusted by many people in Turtle Creek and I'm thrilled to have his support.

@MayorTC https://t.co/MKJZ2G2HuR
This campaign is about everyday issues that impact our municipalities. Thrilled to have the support of Edgewood Borough Mayor, Ryan Oâ€™Donnell. https://t.co/q4OrAZJ5im

Our region is leading in tech innovation. Now we need the infrastructure funding to support the industry and connect our communities to economic and job hubs here. https://t.co/RAUoEtDE0E

In 2021, the Pittsburgh area had an average salary of $98,304 in the tech industry, a 14% increase from the prior year and the largest increase compared to 25 other tech hubs.
https://t.co/CMdj3wCZ6N
Thank you to Bill Strickland and the Manchester Bidwell Corporation (@MBC_PGH) for all you do and all you have done for the community.

@MBC_PGH is a dynamic org that has a proven record of positively changing the lives of underserved populations in the region. Founder Bill Strickland knows the power of art, education, and community so he started a small ceramics program that grew into what the org is today. https://t.co/FlY22sxADu

This campaign is about kitchen table issues impacting our neighborhoods. So this month, we are highlighting local people and orgs working to make our region better for the Black and African American community.
Feb is Black History Month-when we honor local people and organizations working hard to create change, address systemic racism, and make our region better for Black and African American communities.

When our community is heard by our representatives in public office, our community is strong. That's why I'm prioritizing getting to meet and hear from as many of you as possible.

Thanks to the @BPDemocrats, @YoungDems_AGH, and the Pleasant Hills Dems for having me last week! https://t.co/mvFVdsQVPB

I was raised by an immigrant single mom who built a food-truck business in Pgh. I worked in those food trucks on CMU and Pitt campuses.
At the age of 13 I prepped food, took orders, and balanced books. It's where I learned and lived Pgh values - family, hard work, and community. https://t.co/lSEJxhJkKK

Act 77, which established mail in voting, received bipartisan support in the state legislature and made mail in voting possible. That was crucial in the 2020 election during the height of the pandemic here in PA.

This ruling from Commonwealth Court last week is appalling. I am glad an appeal is getting filed.

As a member of Congress, I will always fight for expanded voting rights so that more people are heard in our elections - that means expanding the ability for people to vote by mail. https://t.co/xKHfACcRmA

Today, organizers at @coffeetreeunion in Shadyside held a demonstration for fair pay, safer working conditions, and the ability to organize a union.

I was proud to join their event today with @UFCWLocal1776 in the fight for a better workplace. https://t.co/0QECoSJUUU

Such fun joining members of the Chinese community in our region and see performances celebrating the Lunar New Year. 
Great to see State Senator @LindseyForPA and Allegheny County Executive @votefitz there as well!

Attended the 2022 Greater PGH Lunar New Year Gala hosted by Pittsburgh Chinese Cultural Center at NAHS last night.
Itâ€™s the Year of the Tiger - representing recovery and prosperity. Wishing everyone a happy and prosperous Lunar New Year! #LunarNewYear #Tiger https://t.co/LriAWao29x
We should be able to live and commute safely and without worry. I'll be a member of Congress who remains committed to getting the right type of investment in infrastructure. https://t.co/vcDSo5TDPm

Its terrifying that our bridges are literally crumbling in our communities.

I'm thrilled @POTUS is putting so much focus on our region, and that @USRepMikeDoyle supported the bipartisan infrastructure bill for the biggest investment since 1950s. https://t.co/kMPERZOazi
Grateful for the Presidentâ€™s focus on our region and his understanding that our communities have what it takes to build a better and stronger America.

Had the opportunity to meet President Biden at Mill 19 in Hazelwood Green today.

He gets Pittsburgh and how our community can drive global innovation to solve our generations most pressing challenges while making sure we sustain good paying jobs and uplift the middle class. https://t.co/QqJ1QhtWj2
RT @USRepMikeDoyle: The Forbes Avenue bridge collapse is a major challenge for our community. It will disrupt transportation in PGH for monâ€¦
This is a major bridge that brings people from the east suburbs into the city. Thankful to all the first responders on the scene. Hopeful that everyone is okay. https://t.co/BlW6snU66T

Pittsburgh Insulators Local 2 is a union that impacts the community here through education and leadership. 

When I toured their training center recently, it was easy to see how well their apprenticeship programs set up workers for success. Thank you for having me! https://t.co/LtIMohW0rP

Today is Holocaust Remembrance Day - when we commemorate the end of WW2, and the end of the Holocaust.

The Holocaust is a dreadful part of our world history. We must never repeat it, we must never forget it. https://t.co/GqarNhepwA

Thank you so much to the Baldwin Borough Democratic Committee for welcoming me at your Zoom meeting last night! 
I look forward to when we can meet and continue our conversation together in person.

I look forward to working with all of you in making sure the working men and women of this region, no matter their profession, always have a strong voice fighting for them in Congress. #UnionStrong #Labor #steelcity #carpenters #infrastructure https://t.co/x8dKfjDhPP

Our region is strong because it is diverse. 
I joined the Indian American community in Monroeville to talk about this campaign and learn about the issues that matter to the families who live here. 
Thanks to everyone who joined the conversation.
#PatelforPA #Monroeville https://t.co/VCBG9B1605

Thank you so much to the @EASCarpenters for the tour of the outstanding training center in Collier Twp.

Our infrastructure and buildings that represent the regionâ€™s skyline depend on the work by carpenters trained right here in Southwest PA.

#UnionStrong #Labor #Infrastructure https://t.co/9qPBZ1KsxS

One of the most remarkable things abt running for office is the number of people I get to meet in a short period of time and the stories I get to hold close.

Thank you to the lovely people who sent a handwritten card along with their support. #PA18 #PatelforPA https://t.co/0u4ePPeJDn

Thanks so much to all the South Hills grassroot leaders and volunteers who came out Friday in person and joined virtually to talk about my candidacy, campaign, and what is top of their mind. https://t.co/90SvhtinA1

Bethel Park and the #SouthHills are such an important part of the District Iâ€™m running to represent, and I was happy to have the opportunity to speak with them about the issues they care about. https://t.co/FBKKA7z02I
